X.ii.6.E.3.h
.
Retroactive Benefits in an Award to a Child Who Has Reached the Age of Majority
Per
38 CFR 3.403(a)(2)
, when awarding benefits to a child on or after the date they reach the age of majority, include in the award any retroactive benefits owed to the child, even if the benefits are for a period of time during which the child was a minor.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 6, Section E - Authorizing Awards for Fiduciary Cases
